newsitem.title: DOMINICAN REPUBLIC: Violent protests rock Dominican town.
newsitem.headline: Violent protests rock Dominican town.

text.p: Angry crowds burned tires, blocked streets and threw stones in the Dominican city of Yamasa on Thursday to protest against a 20 percent increase in the cost of public transportation.
Local radio reports said crowds of youths stopped a dozen buses from leaving the city for Santo Domingo, about 35 miles (55 km) to the southwest, leaving hundreds stranded.
The exact number of protesters was not known. A spokesman for the National Police in Santo Domingo said a team of riot police had been sent to the city to restore order.
Bus companies raised their prices in the past week, following a government-mandated 20 percent increase in the cost of fuel.
